Katie Jane Evans (2001â08) }} '''Daniel "Danny" Huston''' (born May 14, 1962) is an American actor and director. ==Early life== Huston was born in Rome, Italy. He hails from the illustrious Huston acting and filmmaking dynasty. He is the son of legendary director [[John Huston]], half-brother of actress [[Anjelica Huston]] and screenwriter Tony Huston, uncle of actor [[Jack Huston]], stepbrother of [[Allegra Huston]], and grandson of [[Academy Awards|Academy Award]]-winning actor [[Walter Huston]]. His mother, Zoe Sallis, was an actress and author whose ancestry was [[Anglo-Indian|Indian and English]].{{cite news|last=Carr|first=Jay|coauthors=|title=HAVING NOAH FOR A FATHER TO HIS SON DANNY, JOHN HUSTON WAS INDEED LARGER THAN LIFE|pages=|publisher=Boston Globe|date=1988-07-31|url=http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/boston/access/59651922.html?dids=59651922:59651922&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Jul+31%2C+1988&author=Jay+Carr%2C+Globe+Staff&pub=Boston+Globe+(pre-1997+Fulltext)&desc=HAVING+NOAH+FOR+A+FATHER+TO+HIS+SON+DANNY%2C+JOHN+HUSTON+WAS+INDEED+LARGER+THAN+LIFE&pqatl=google|accessdate=2010-05-17|quote=My mother's half Indian, half English}} Huston was conceived as a result of an affair between Sallis and John Huston.{{Cite news|last=Synnot|first=Siobhan|coauthors=|title=Name of the father â Danny Huston|pages=|publisher=Scotland on Sunday|date=2008-06-15|url=http://scotlandonsunday.scotsman.com/edinburghinternationalfilmfestival/Name-of-the-father-.4184801.jp|accessdate=2010-12-03}} ==Career== His father, John Huston, produced Danny's first [[Feature film|feature]] as a director, ''[[Mr. North]]'', an adaptation of [[Thornton Wilder]]'s last novel, ''Theophilus North''. In 1995's ''[[Leaving Las Vegas]]'', he moved in front of the camera and has since acted in over 20 films. He gave his breakthrough acting performance in the independent film ''[[Ivans Xtc]]''. The [[Bernard Rose (director)|Bernard Rose]] feature was nominated for several Independent Spirit Awards in 2003, including Best Male Performance for Hustonâs portrayal of Hollywood talent agent Ivan Beckman. Huston has worked nonstop as an actor ever since. Soon after ''Ivans Xtc'', he worked on [[Martin Scorsese]]'s ''[[The Aviator (2004 film)|The Aviator]]'' alongside [[Leonardo DiCaprio]] and [[Alec Baldwin]], for which the ensemble cast was nominated for a 2004 SAG Award. In 2006, Huston received the Golden Satellite Award for Best Supporting Actor for his performance as Sandy Woodrow in Fernando Meirelles' ''[[The Constant Gardener (film)|The Constant Gardener]]''. That same year, Huston starred in the critically acclaimed Australian ''western'' ''[[The Proposition]]'' alongside [[Guy Pearce]] and [[Emily Watson]]. The film premiered at the Sundance Film Festival. Huston also starred in the British independent features ''[[Alpha Male (film)|Alpha Male]]'' and Oliver Parkerâs ''[[Fade to Black (2006 film)|Fade to Black]]'', in which he played [[Orson Welles]] alongside [[Christopher Walken]] and [[Paz Vega]]. He has collaborated several times with British directors Mike Figgis and Bernard Rose, most recently with Rose on ''[[The Kreutzer Sonata (2008 film)|The Kreutzer Sonata]]'', which premiered at the 2008 Edinburgh International Film Festival. His other film credits include ''[[Birth (film)|Birth]]'', ''[[Silver City (2004 film)|Silver City]]'', ''[[Marie Antoinette (2006 film)|Marie Antoinette]]'', ''[[The Number 23]]'', ''[[The Kingdom (film)|The Kingdom]]'', ''[[How to Lose Friends & Alienate People (film)|How to Lose Friends & Alienate People]]'' and ''[[30 Days of Night (film)|30 Days of Night]]''. He most recently portrayed [[Samuel Adams]] in the award-winning [[HBO]] miniseries ''[[John Adams (TV miniseries)|John Adams]]''. He also portrayed [[Colonel William Stryker]] in ''[[X-Men Origins: Wolverine]]'', a prequel for the trilogy. His 2009â10 roles include ''[[Boogie Woogie (film)|Boogie Woogie]]'', ''[[The Warrior's Way]]'', the thriller ''[[Edge of Darkness (2010 film)|Edge of Darkness]]'', and the adventure films ''[[Clash of the Titans (2010 film)|Clash of the Titans]]'' and ''[[Robin Hood (2010 film)|Robin Hood]]''. Recently, he played the famous lawyer [[Geoffrey Fieger]] HBO's film ''[[You Don't Know Jack (film)|You Don't Know Jack]]''. Huston will also feature alongside [[Nicolas Cage]] in the [[Simon West]] directed film ''[[Medallion (film)|Medallion]]''. ==Personal life== Huston has twice been married. His first wife was Academy Award nominee, [[Virginia Madsen]]. His second wife, Katie Jane Evans, whom he married in 2001 and separated from in 2006, committed suicide in October 2008 before the divorce was finalized. Together, they had one daughter named Stella.[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1080659/English-beauty-dies-roof-plunge-marriage-split-John-Hustons-son.html Daily Mail] ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable" !
